name: Overview
main:
Almost half of the population is need of assistance. Conflict has resulted in displacement, targeted killings along communal lines, and human rights abuses. Protection, humanitarian access, and food security are priority needs. Needs continue to exceed available resources, and delivery of aid is expected to continue to decline because funding remains low. 

Since November 2016, fighting among ex-Seleka as well as with anti-balaka in central CAR has resulted in large numbers of displacement, as well as access and protection concerns. Fighting is moving south, with clashes in Haute Kotto, Basse-Kotto, Haut Mbomou, and Mbomou the deadliest since the division of the Seleka faction in 2014.

INFORM measures CAR's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be extremely high, at 8.4/10. CAR's vulnerability is of particular concern.?
latest_developments_past:
30/06: At least 22 people have been killed due to fighting between unknown armed groups in Zemio, Haut-Mbomou. More than 1,000 people have been displaced and some Congolese refugees, hosted in camp in Zemio, have reportedly fled back to DRC.? ?

30/06: IDPs, returnees, low-income populations, and households in conflict-affected areas (Ouaka, Ouham, Ouham Pende, Nana-Gribizi, Vakaga)â€‹ face food insecurity and are expected to remain at least in Crisis (IPC Phase 3) until January 2018 due to disrupted agricultural activities.?

28/06: 40-50% of houses in Bria have been destroyed following ongoing fighting since May. Shelter are needs are high as it is currently the rainy season.?

26/06: IFRC staff person killed by unknown armed men in Bangassou. Mbomou. In addition, over 2,000 Muslims have been trapped in a church since late May, and cannot access health facilities, fearing attacks by anti-balaka.??
